Screenplay: Quentin Tarantino
Cast: Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger, Melanie Laurent, Christoph Waltz, Daniel Bruhl, Eli Roth, Samm Levine, BJ Novak, Til Schweiger, Gedeon Burkhard, Paul Rust, Michael Bacall, Omar Doom, Sylvester Groth, Julie Dreyfus, Jacky Ido, August Diehl, Martin Wuttke, Richard Sammel, Christian Berkel, Sonke Mohring, Michael Fassbender, Mike Myers, Rod Taylor, Denis Menochet, Cloris Leachman, Maggie Cheung, Samuel L. Jackson
Rating: PG-13

Synopsis:
During the first year of the German occupation of France, Dreyfus Shosanna witnesses the execution of his family at the hand of Nazi Colonel Hans Landa. Shosanna escapes and flees to Paris where she forges a new identity as the owner and operator of a cinema.

Elsewhere in Europe, Lieutenant Aldo Raine (Brad Pitt) organizes a group of Jewish soldiers to brutal retribution against individual targets. Known to their enemy as "The Basterds," Raine's men join German actress Bridget Von Hammersmark (Diane Kruger), a secret agent working for the allies to carry out a mission that will fall leaders of the Third Reich. Destiny wants everyone under the marquee of a movie theater waiting Shosanna revenge.

Using the genre of melodrama, propaganda and the New Wave, DAMN BASTARDS / Inglourious Basterds, directed by Quentin Tarantino, proposes a new vision of World War II through an inglorious history, real and stronger than life itself .

Production notes:
- Its global revenue amounted to 300 million dollars for a budget of 70 million.
- Seventh film written and directed by Quentin Tarantino.
- Award winner for Best Actress for Melanie Laurent in the V edition of the Copa de Cine 'The Seventh Art "(2009).
- Winner of Best Actor for CHRISTOPH WALTZ on the V edition of the Copa de Cine 'The Seventh Art "(2009).
- Winner of Best Director QUENTIN TARANTINO at the V edition of the Copa de Cine 'The Seventh Art "(2009).
- Winner of Best Film at the V edition of the Copa de Cine 'The Seventh Art "(2009).
